intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. vulgatiflorum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often hairy. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It is characterized by its ability to form dense colonies, often in disturbed soils and open habitats. Botanically, it is distinguished by its subterranean runners and the presence of glandular hairs on its foliage.
